channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ポスト・ミレニアル紙とヒューマン・イベント紙のウェブサイトが5月2日遅くにハッキングされ、改ざんされた。
item.description:
AJ Vicens / CyberScoop:
The Post Millennial and Human Events websites were hacked and defaced late May 2, initially with links added to datasets of subscribers, writers, and editors  —  The hack included links to download subscriber data and a message claiming that Post Millennial's editor was transitioning to a woman.

item.title: AI企業に対するニュースパブリッシャーの相反するアプローチと、データマーケットプレイスの欠如がいかに買い手と売り手の料金設定を難しくしているかを考察（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
A look at news publishers' conflicting approaches toward AI companies, and how the lack of a data marketplace makes it hard for buyers and sellers to set rates  —  - The new suits add heft to the Times' claims. … Several other large news publishers, including the Financial Times …

item.title: X、Grok AIがキュレーションし要約したニュースを提供する「Stories on X」を開始、プレミアム会員向けにiOSとウェブのExploreタブで提供（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
X launches Stories on X, with news curated and summarized by Grok AI, available for Premium subscribers in the Explore tab on iOS and on the web  —  X, formerly Twitter, is now using Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok to power a feature that summarizes the personalized trending stories in the app's Explore section.

item.title: 書簡の中で、州の選挙管理官を務める複数の民主党議員は、2020年の選挙が盗まれたと主張する広告を許可する政策を廃止するようメタに要請している（Christina A. Cassidy/Associated Press）。
item.description:
Christina A. Cassidy / Associated Press:
In a letter, several Democrats serving as their state's top election officials ask Meta to repeal a policy allowing ads that claim the 2020 election was stolen  —  Several Democrats serving as their state's top election officials have sent a letter to the parent company of Facebook …

item.title: 情報筋：パラマウント・グローバル社では、スカイダンス-レッドバード、ソニー・ピクチャーズ-アポロの2つのオファーはどちらも実現しないと見ている（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Sources: the expectation at Paramount Global is that neither of the two offers in play, Skydance-RedBird and Sony Pictures-Apollo, will come to fruition  —  After months of M&A talks, Paramount Global and controlling shareholder Shari Redstone might be going it alone after all.

item.title: イーロン・マスクは、Grokが記事本文を見ずにXの投稿だけを頼りにニュースの要約を作成することを望んでおり、記事の引用も改善されると述べている（Alex Kantrowitz/Big Technology）。
item.description:
Alex Kantrowitz / Big Technology:
Elon Musk says he wants Grok to create news summaries by relying solely on X posts, without looking at article text, and improved story citations are coming  —  Musk emails with details on AI-powered news inside X. An AI bot will summarize news and commentary, sometimes looking through tens of thousands of posts per story.

item.title: ルーシー・フレイザー英文化相にインタビュー、レッドバードIMIによるテレグラフ買収阻止、外国人持ち株比率を5％に制限する計画などについて（フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Financial Times:
An interview with UK culture secretary Lucy Frazer on blocking RedBird IMI's Telegraph takeover bid, plans to cap foreign state ownership at 5%, and more  —  Culture secretary says UK ‘not stopping’ foreign investment as she defends blocking sale to Abu Dhabi-backed company

item.title: ジェフ・ローソンのGlobal Tetrahedronは、G/Oの広告重視のアプローチから脱却するため、The Onionの会員制を計画し、ハードなペイウォールを設置する予定はない（Steven Levy/Wired）
item.description:
Steven Levy / Wired:
Jeff Lawson's Global Tetrahedron plans membership tiers for The Onion and doesn't plan to put up a hard paywall, as it moves away from G/O's ad-focused approach  —  Entrepreneur Jeff Lawson's plan to revive venerable satirical outlet The Onion involves borrowing from the playbook of the founders of WhatsApp.

item.title: RSFが「世界報道の自由度指数」を発表、ノルウェー、デンマーク、スウェーデンがトップ3、アメリカは10ランクダウンの55、エリトリアは最下位（Tom McArthur/BBC）
item.description:
Tom McArthur / BBC:
RSF publishes its World Press Freedom Index and places Norway, Denmark, and Sweden in the top three, the US down 10 spots at 55, and Eritrea in last place  —  Gaza is one of the deadliest places in the world to be a journalist, according to Reporters Without Borders

item.title: Fubo、第1四半期末のFuboTV加入者数は151万で第4四半期の161万から減少、売上は前年同期比24%増の$394M、損失は$5610Mで前年同期の$8360Mから減少（Etan Vlessing/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Etan Vlessing / The Hollywood Reporter:
Fubo reports 1.51M FuboTV subscribers at the end of Q1, down from 1.61M in Q4, revenue up 24% YoY to $394M, and a $56.1M loss, down from $83.6M a year ago  —  The streaming platform shrunk its losses on higher subscription and advertising revenue.  —  Sports streaming platform FuboTV …

item.title: ガーディアン紙が「少数の希望退職」計画を発表、60％が読者からの資金で賄われ、2024年3月期は3900万ポンドの赤字に（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
The Guardian outlines plans for a “small number of voluntary redundancies”, says it is 60% funded by readers, and had a £39m loss in the year to March 2024  —  Editor Katharine Viner said the business foresees revenue pressures continuing into the next year at least.

item.title: コロンビア・ジャーナリズム・スクールの大学院生たちは数週間にわたって抗議活動を記録し、教授たちはキャンパスが封鎖される中、アクセスと安全の確保に努めた（Charlotte Klein/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Charlotte Klein / Vanity Fair:
For weeks, grad students at The Columbia Journalism School have chronicled protests, and professors worked to ensure access and safety as the campus locked down  —  They've gotten a crash course in breaking news, capturing the Hamilton Hall occupation and the NYPD's crackdown, while surviving on pizza and operating on little sleep.

item.title: 業界縮小の中、2023年のメディアCEO給与を見る：チャーターCEOクリス・ウィンフリー8900万ドル、エンデバーCEOアリ・エマニュエル8400万ドル、WBD CEOデービッド・ザスラブ4970万ドルなど（Jill Goldsmith/Deadline）
item.description:
Jill Goldsmith / Deadline:
A look at 2023 media CEO pay amid industry contraction: Charter CEO Chris Winfrey, $89M; Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel, $84M; WBD CEO David Zaslav, $49.7M; and more  —  It was a year of pain for the entertainment industry and shareholders of (many) media companies with months-long Hollywood strikes and layoffs.

item.title: 情報筋MLBは今季、Rokuを日曜朝の野球中継の新たな本拠地とする方向で交渉を進めており、Rokuにとって初の大型放映権契約となる（Andrew Marchand/The Athletic）
item.description:
Andrew Marchand / The Athletic:
Sources: MLB is in advanced talks to make Roku the new home for Sunday morning baseball this season, in what would be Roku's first major live rights deal  —  Major League Baseball and Roku are in advanced talks to make the service the new home for Sunday morning baseball this season …

item.title: 情報筋：NBAは、ディズニーとアマゾンからそれぞれ年間26億ドルと18億ドルを含む、11年間で760億ドルをリーグに支払う契約締結に近づいている（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Sources: the NBA is close to signing deals that would pay the league ~$76B over 11 years, including $2.6B and $1.8B a year from Disney and Amazon, respectively  —  The National Basketball Association is close to signing new long-term broadcasting agreements that would pay the league …
